description: Little Rock Superintendent Dexter Suggs said Tuesday that a plan for raising student achievement in six academically distressed schools and throughout the district is a quality initiative, but he is uncertain whether district leadership is united enough to pull it off.
title: LR school chief: Unity, focus iffy
title_page: LR school chief: Unity, focus iffy
text:
“We’ve failed generation after generation after generation” at six academically distressed schools in the Little Rock district, Superintendent Dexter Suggs told members of the Arkansas Board of Education at Tuesday’s hearing. He said district leadership “hasn’t been there.” - Photo by Staton Breidenthal
Little Rock Superintendent Dexter Suggs said Tuesday that a plan for raising student achievement in six academically distressed schools and throughout the district is a quality initiative, but he is uncertain whether district leadership is united enough to pull it off.
